episode_title: 101 - The One Where Monica Gets a New Roommate (The Pilot-The Uncut Version)
note: (Note: The previously unseen parts of this episode are shown in blue text.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, Phoebe, and Monica are there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There’s nothing to tell! He’s just some guy I work with!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: C’mon, you’re going out with the guy! There’s gotta be something wrong with him!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right Joey, be nice. So does he have a hump? A hump and a hairpiece?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, does he eat chalk?
(They all stare, bemused.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Just, ’cause, I don’t want her to go through what I went through with Carl- oh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, everybody relax. This is not even a date. It’s just two people going out to dinner and- not having sex.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sounds like a date to me.
[Time Lapse]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, so I’m back in high school, I’m standing in the middle of the cafeteria, and I realize I am totally naked.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, yeah. Had that dream.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then I look down, and I realize there’s a phone… there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Instead of…?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Never had that dream.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All of a sudden, the phone starts to ring. Now I don’t know what to do, everybody starts looking at me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And they weren’t looking at you before?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Finally, I figure I’d better answer it, and it turns out it’s my mother, which is very-very weird, because- she never calls me!
[Time Lapse, Ross has entered.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This guy says hello, I wanna kill myself.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you okay, sweetie?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just feel like someone reached down my throat, grabbed my small intestine, pulled it out of my mouth and tied it around my neck…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Cookie?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Carol moved her stuff out today.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let me get you some coffee.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! Oh! (She starts to pluck at the air just in front of Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no don’t! Stop cleansing my aura! No, just leave my aura alone, okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine! Be murky!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ll be fine, alright? Really, everyone. I hope she’ll be very happy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No you don’t.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No I don’t, to hell with her, she left me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And you never knew she was a lesbian…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!! Okay?! Why does everyone keep fixating on that? She didn’t know, how should I know?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sometimes I wish I was a lesbian… (They all stare at him.) Did I say that out loud?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I told mom and dad last night, they seemed to take it pretty well.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh really, so that hysterical phone call I got from a woman at sobbing 3:00 A.M., “I’ll never have grandchildren, I’ll never have grandchildren.” was what? A wrong number?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright Ross, look. You’re feeling a lot of pain right now. You’re angry. You’re hurting. Can I tell you what the answer is?
(Ross gestures his consent.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Strip joint! C’mon, you’re single! Have some hormones!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t want to be single, okay? I just… I just- I just wanna be married again!
(Rachel enters in a wet wedding dress and starts to search the room.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I just want a million dollars! (He extends his hand hopefully.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God Monica hi! Thank God! I just went to your building and you weren’t there and then this guy with a big hammer said you might be here and you are, you are!

content.speaker: Waitress
content.text: Can I get you some coffee?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: De-caff. (to All) Okay, everybody, this is Rachel, another Lincoln High survivor. (to Rachel) This is everybody, this is Chandler, and Phoebe, and Joey, and- you remember my brother Ross?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, sure!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.
(They go to hug but Ross’s umbrella opens. He sits back down defeated again. A moment of silence follows as Rachel sits and the others expect her to explain.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So you wanna tell us now, or are we waiting for four wet bridesmaids?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God… well, it started about a half hour before the wedding. I was in the room where we were keeping all the presents, and I was looking at this gravy boat. This really gorgeous Lamauge gravy boat. When all of a sudden- (to the waitress that brought her coffee)Sweet ‘n’ Lo?- I realized that I was more turned on by this gravy boat than by Barry! And then I got really freaked out, and that’s when it hit me: how much Barry looks like Mr. Potato Head. Y’know, I mean, I always knew looked familiar, but… Anyway, I just had to get out of there, and I started wondering ‘Why am I doing this, and who am I doing this for?’. (to Monica) So anyway I just didn’t know where to go, and I know that you and I have kinda drifted apart, but you’re the only person I knew who lived here in the city.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who wasn’t invited to the wedding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, I was kinda hoping that wouldn’t be an issue… [Scene: Monica’s Apartment, everyone is there and watching a Spanish Soap on TV and are trying to figure out what is going on.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now I’m guessing that he bought her the big pipe organ, and she’s really not happy about it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Tuna or egg salad? Decide!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ll have whatever Christine is having.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Daddy, I just… I can’t marry him! I’m sorry. I just don’t love him. Well, it matters to me!
(The scene on TV has changed to show two women, one is holding her hair.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: If I let go of my hair, my head will fall off.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, she should not be wearing those pants.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I say push her down the stairs.

content.speaker: Phoebe, Ross, Chandler, and Joey
content.text: Push her down the stairs! Push her down the stairs! Push her down the stairs!
(She is pushed down the stairs and everyone cheers.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: C’mon Daddy, listen to me! It’s like, it’s like, all of my life, everyone has always told me, ‘You’re a shoe! You’re a shoe, you’re a shoe, you’re a shoe!’. And today I just stopped and I said, ‘What if I don’t wanna be a shoe? What if I wanna be a- a purse, y’know? Or a- or a hat! No, I’m not saying I want you to buy me a hat, I’m saying I am a ha- It’s a metaphor, Daddy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You can see where he’d have trouble.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look Daddy, it’s my life. Well maybe I’ll just stay here with Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I guess we’ve established who’s staying here with Monica…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, maybe that’s my decision. Well, maybe I don’t need your money. Wait!! Wait, I said maybe!!
[Time Lapse, Rachel is breating into a paper bag.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just breathe, breathe.. that’s it. Just try to think of nice calm things…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Raindrops on roses and rabbits and kittens, (Rachel and Monica turn to look at her.) bluebells and sleighbells and- something with mittens… La la la la… something and noodles with string. These are a few…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m all better now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I helped!
content.parenthetical: grins and walks to the kitchen and says to Chandler and Joey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, look, this is probably for the best, y’know? Independence. Taking control of your life. The whole, ‘hat’ thing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And hey, you need anything, you can always come to Joey. Me and Chandler live across the hall. And he’s away a lot.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, stop hitting on her! It’s her wedding day!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What, like there’s a rule or something?
(The door buzzer sounds and Chandler gets it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Please don’t do that again, it’s a horrible sound.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: It’s, uh, it’s Paul.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God, is it 6:30? Buzz him in!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who’s Paul?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Paul the Wine Guy, Paul?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait. Your ‘not a real date’ tonight is with Paul the Wine Guy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He finally asked you out?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, this is a Dear Diary moment.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, wait, I can cancel…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Please, no, go, that’d be fine!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are, are you okay? I mean, do you want me to stay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’d be good…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, go on! It’s Paul the Wine Guy!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What does that mean? Does he sell it, drink it, or just complain a lot? (Chandler doesn’t know.)
(There’s a knock on the door and it’s Paul.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, come in! Paul, this is.. (They are all lined up next to the door.)… everybody, everybody, this is Paul.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey! Paul! Hi! The Wine Guy! Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry, I didn’t catch your name. Paul, was it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, umm-umm, I’ll just—I’ll be right back, I just gotta go ah, go ah…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A wandering?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Change! Okay, sit down. (Shows Paul in) Two seconds.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, I just pulled out four eyelashes. That can’t be good.
(Monica goes to change.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Paul!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here’s a little tip, she really likes it when you rub her neck in the same spot over and over and over again until it starts to get a little red.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shut up, Joey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So Rachel, what’re you, uh… what’re you up to tonight?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I was kinda supposed to be headed for Aruba on my honeymoon, so nothing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right, you’re not even getting your honeymoon, God.. No, no, although, Aruba, this time of year… talk about your- (thinks) -big lizards… Anyway, if you don’t feel like being alone tonight, Joey and Chandler are coming over to help me put together my new furniture.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, and we’re very excited about it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well actually thanks, but I think I’m just gonna hang out here tonight. It’s been kinda a long day.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, sure.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Pheebs, you wanna help?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I wish I could, but I don’t want to.
[Scene: The Subway, Phoebe is singing for change.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Love is sweet as summer showers, love is a wondrous work of art, but your love oh your love, your love…is like a giant pigeon…crapping on my heart. La-la-la-la-la- (some guy gives her some change and to that guy) Thank you. (sings) La-la-la-la…ohhh!

content.description: Ross’s Apartment, the guys are there assembling furniture.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m supposed to attach a brackety thing to the side things, using a bunch of these little worm guys. I have no brackety thing, I see no whim guys whatsoever and- I cannot feel my legs.
(Joey and Chandler are finishing assembling the bookcase.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m thinking we’ve got a bookcase here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a beautiful thing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s this?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I would have to say that is an ‘L’-shaped bracket.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Which goes where?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I have no idea.
(Joey checks that Ross is not looking and dumps it in a plant.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Done with the bookcase!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All finished!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This was Carol’s favorite beer. She always drank it out of the can, I should have known.
content.parenthetical: clutching a beer can and sniffing

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey-hey-hey, if you’re gonna start with that stuff we’re outta here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, please don’t spoil all this fun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross, let me ask you a question. She got the furniture, the stereo, the good TV- what did you get?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, God.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got screwed.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.description: A Restaurant, Monica and Paul are eating.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: I know, I know, I’m such an idiot. I guess I should have caught on when she started going to the dentist four and five times a week. I mean, how clean can teeth get?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My brother’s going through that right now, he’s such a mess. How did you get through it?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Well, you might try accidentally breaking something valuable of hers, say her-

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: -leg?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: That’s one way! Me, I- I went for the watch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You actually broke her watch? Wow! The worst thing I ever did was, I-I shredded by boyfriend’s favorite bath towel.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Ooh, steer clear of you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right. [Scene: Monica’s Apartment, Rachel is talking on the phone and pacing.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Barry, I’m sorry… I am so sorry… I know you probably think that this is all about what I said the other day about you making love with your socks on, but it isn’t… it isn’t, it’s about me, and I ju- (She stops talking and dials the phone.) Hi, machine cut me off again… anyway… look, look, I know that some girl is going to be incredibly lucky to become Mrs. Barry Finkel, but it isn’t me, it’s not me. And not that I have any idea who me is right now, but you just have to give me a chance too… (The maching cuts her off again and she redials.)

content.description: Ross’s Apartment; Ross is pacing while Joey and Chandler are working on some more furniture.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m divorced! I’m only 26 and I’m divorced!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Shut up!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You must stop! (Chandler hits what he is working on with a hammer and it collapses.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That only took me an hour.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, Ross, you gotta understand, between us we haven’t had a relationship that has lasted longer than a Mento. You , however have had the love of a woman for four years. Four years of closeness and sharing at the end of which she ripped your heart out, and that is why we don’t do it! I don’t think that was my point!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know what the scariest part is? What if there’s only one woman for everybody, y’know? I mean what if you get one woman- and that’s it? Unfortunately in my case, there was only one woman- for her…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you talking about? ‘One woman’? That’s like saying there’s only one flavor of ice cream for you. Lemme tell you something, Ross. There’s lots of flavors out there. There’s Rocky Road, and Cookie Dough, and Bing! Cherry Vanilla. You could get ’em with Jimmies, or nuts, or whipped cream! This is the best thing that ever happened to you! You got married, you were, like, what, eight? Welcome back to the world! Grab a spoon!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I honestly don’t know if I’m hungry or horny.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stay out of my freezer! [Scene: A Restaurant, Monica and Paul are still eating.]

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Ever since she walked out on me, I, uh…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?… What, you wanna spell it out with noodles?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: No, it’s, it’s more of a fifth date kinda revelation.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, so there is gonna be a fifth date?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Isn’t there?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah… yeah, I think there is. -What were you gonna say?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Well, ever-ev-… ever since she left me, um, I haven’t been able to, uh, perform. (Monica takes a sip of her drink.) …Sexually.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God, oh God, I am sorry… I am so sorry…
content.parenthetical: spitting out her drink in shock

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: It’s okay…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know being spit on is probably not what you need right now. Um… how long?

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Two years.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! I’m-I’m-I’m glad you smashed her watch!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: So you still think you, um… might want that fifth date?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: …Yeah. Yeah, I do.

content.description: [Scene: Monica’s Apartment, Rachel is watching Joanne Loves Chaci.]

content.speaker: Priest on TV
content.text: We are gathered here today to join Joanne Louise Cunningham and Charles, Chachi-Chachi-Chachi, Arcola in the bound of holy matrimony.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh…see… but Joanne loved Chachi! That’s the difference!

content.description: Ross’s Apartment, they’re all sitting around and talking.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Grab a spoon. Do you know how long it’s been since I’ve grabbed a spoon? Do the words ‘Billy, don’t be a hero’ mean anything to you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great story! But, I uh, I gotta go, I got a date with Andrea—Angela—Andrea… Oh man, (looks to Chandler)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Angela’s the screamer, Andrea has cats.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right. Thanks. It’s June. I’m outta here. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, here’s the thing. Even if I could get it together enough to- to ask a woman out,… who am I gonna ask? (He gazes out of the window.)
[Cut to Rachel staring out of her window.]

content.description: Monica’s Apartment, Rachel is making coffee for Joey and Chandler.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Isn’t this amazing? I mean, I have never made coffee before in my entire life.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That is amazing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Congratulations.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, I figure if I can make coffee, there isn’t anything I can’t do.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If can invade Poland, there isn’t anything I can’t do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, while you’re on a roll, if you feel like you gotta make like a Western omelet or something… (Joey and Chandler taste the coffee, grimace, and pour it into a plant pot.) Although actually I’m really not that hungry…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh good, Lenny and Squigy are here.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Morning. Good morning.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Morning.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Morning, Paul.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello, Paul.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, Paul, is it?
(Monica and Paul walk to the door and talk in a low voice so the others can’t hear. The others move Monica’s table closer to the door so that they can.)

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Thank you! Thank you so much!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Stop!

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: No, I’m telling you last night was like umm, all my birthdays, both graduations, plus the barn raising scene in Witness .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’ll talk later.

content.speaker: Paul
content.text: Yeah. (They kiss) Thank you. (Exits)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That wasn’t a real date?! What the hell do you do on a real date?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shut up, and put my table back.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Okayyy! (They do so.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, kids, I gotta get to work. If I don’t input those numbers,… it doesn’t make much of a difference…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, like, you guys all have jobs?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, we all have jobs. See, that’s how we buy stuff.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I’m an actor.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! Would I have seen you in anything?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I doubt it. Mostly regional work.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh wait, wait, unless you happened to catch the Reruns’ production of Pinocchio , at the little theater in the park.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, it was a job all right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ‘Look, Gippetto, I’m a real live boy.’

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I will not take this abuse. (Walks to the door and opens it to leave.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re right, I’m sorry. (Burst into song and dances out of the door.) “ Once I was a wooden boy, a little wooden boy… ”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You should both know, that he’s a dead man. Oh, Chandler? (Starts after Chandler.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So how you doing today? Did you sleep okay? Talk to Barry? I can’t stop smiling.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can see that. You look like you slept with a hanger in your mouth.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, he’s just so, so… Do you remember you and Tony DeMarco?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, it’s like that. With feelings.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wow. Are you in trouble.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Big time!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Want a wedding dress? Hardly used.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think we are getting a little ahead of selves here. Okay. Okay. I am just going to get up, go to work and not think about him all day. Or else I’m just gonna get up and go to work.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, look, wish me luck!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What for?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m gonna go get one of those (Thinks) job things.
(Monica exits.)

content.description: Iridium, Monica is working as Frannie enters.

content.speaker: Frannie
content.text: Hey, Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Frannie, welcome back! How was Florida?

content.speaker: Frannie
content.text: You had sex, didn’t you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How do you do that?

content.speaker: Frannie
content.text: Oh, I hate you, I’m pushing my Aunt Roz through Parrot Jungle and you’re having sex! So? Who?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know Paul?

content.speaker: Frannie
content.text: Paul the Wine Guy? Oh yeah, I know Paul.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You mean you know Paul like I know Paul?

content.speaker: Frannie
content.text: Are you kidding? I take credit for Paul. Y’know before me, there was no snap in his turtle for two years.

content.description: Central Perk, everyone but Rachel is there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Of course it was a line!
content.parenthetical: sitting on the arm of the couch

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?! Why? Why, why would anybody do something like that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I assume we’re looking for an answer more sophisticated than ‘to get you into bed’.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I hate men! I hate men!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, don’t hate, you don’t want to put that out into the universe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is it me? Is it like I have some sort of beacon that only dogs and men with severe emotional problems can hear?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, c’mere, gimme your feet. (She starts massaging them.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just thought he was nice, y’know?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe you didn’t know it was a line!
(Monica pushes him off of the sofa as Rachel enters with a shopping bag.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Guess what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You got a job?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you kidding? I’m trained for nothing! I was laughed out of twelve interviews today.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And yet you’re surprisingly upbeat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You would be too if you found John and David boots on sale, fifty percent off!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, how well you know me…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: They’re my new ‘I don’t need a job, I don’t need my parents, I’ve got great boots’ boots!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How’d you pay for them?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, credit card.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And who pays for that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um… my… father.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is sitting around the kitchen table. Rachel’s credit cards are spread out on the table along with a pair of scissors.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, come on you guys, is this really necessary? I mean, I can stop charging anytime I want.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: C’mon, you can’t live off your parents your whole life.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know that. That’s why I was getting married.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Give her a break, it’s hard being on your own for the first time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re welcome. I remember when I first came to this city. I was fourteen. My mom had just killed herself and my step-dad was back in prison, and I got here, and I didn’t know anybody. And I ended up living with this albino guy who was, like, cleaning windshields outside port authority, and then he killed himself, and then I found aromatherapy. So believe me, I know exactly how you feel.
(Pause)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The word you’re looking for is ‘Anyway’…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, you ready?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. No, no, I’m not ready! How can I be ready? “Hey, Rach! You ready to jump out the airplane without your parachute?” Come on, I can’t do this!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You can, I know you can!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, you made coffee! You can do anything! (Chandler slowly tries to hide the now dead plant from that morning when he and Joey poured their coffee into it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon, cut. Cut, cut, cut,…

content.speaker: All
content.text: Cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut… (She cuts one of them and they cheer.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what? I think we can just leave it at that. It’s kinda like a symbolic gesture…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel! That was a library card!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut..

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, if you listen closely, you can hear a thousand retailers scream.
content.parenthetical: as Rachel is cutting up her cards

content.text: (She finishes cutting them up and they all cheer.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Welcome to the real world! It sucks. You’re gonna love it!
[Time Lapse, Rachel and Ross are watching a TV channel finishes it’s broadcast day by playing the national anthem.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, that’s it (To Ross) You gonna crash on the couch?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No, I gotta go home sometime.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You be okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Mon, look what I just found on the floor. (Monica smiles.) What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s Paul’s watch. You just put it back where you found it. Oh boy. Alright. Goodnight, everybody.

content.speaker: Ross and Rachel
content.text: Goodnight.
(Monica stomps on Paul’s watch and goes into her room.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mmm. (They both reach for the last cookie) Oh, no-

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sorry-

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No no no, go-

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, you have it, really, I don’t want it-

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Split it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (They split it.) You know you probably didn’t know this, but back in high school, I had a, um, major crush on you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I knew.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You did! Oh… I always figured you just thought I was Monica’s geeky older brother.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I did.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. Listen, do you think- and try not to let my intense vulnerability become any kind of a factor here- but do you think it would be okay if I asked you out? Sometime? Maybe?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, maybe…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay… okay, maybe I will…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Goodnight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Goodnight.
(Rachel goes into her room and Monica enters the living room as Ross is leaving.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See ya… Waitwait, what’s with you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just grabbed a spoon. (Ross exits and Monica has no idea what that means.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe what I’m hearing here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe what I’m hearing here…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? I-I said you had a-

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What I said you had…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Would you stop?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, was I doing it again?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I said that you had a nice butt, it’s just not a great butt.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you wouldn’t know a great butt if it came up and bit ya.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There’s an image.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Would anybody like more coffee?
content.parenthetical: walks up with a pot of coffee

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did you make it, or are you just serving it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m just serving it.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, I’ll have a cup of coffee.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Kids, new dream… I’m in Las Vegas. (Rachel sits down to hear Chandler’s dream.)

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: Ahh, miss? More coffee?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh. (To another customer that’s leaving.) Excuse me, could you give this to that guy over there? (Hands him the coffee pot.) Go ahead. (He does so.) Thank you. (To the gang.) Sorry. Okay, Las Vegas.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so, I’m in Las Vegas… I’m Liza Minelli-
